intro: Galianthe corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered galianthe, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Galianthe corymbosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
